comment: Ms. Anglin is the kindest professor ever. She teaches by reading off a powerpoint, but gives us the exact topics we need to study for every super quiz. I've learned a lot in her class. The Iclicker/attendance grades are annoying though.

Professor Anglin is a great professor! She gives a ton of extra credit which bumped me at least 2 or 3 points. I didn't do great on the super quizzes and failed a few but they are weighted the same as homework so it wasn't a big deal and didn't hurt my grade. As long as you do the homework and go to class (attendance is mandatory) you'll be fine.

Professor Anglin is one of the best! Attendance is mandatory, but worth it—she truly helps you understand the lab, not just complete it. She's patient, available outside class, and genuinely cares about her students' success. Super helpful and kind. Highly recommend!

I was not a big fan of her.All of her tests were on lockdown browser, and she does watch them. Her lectures are just her reading off a PowerPoint. She does give a lot of extra credit, which is nice. She doesn't round up grades, and attendance is technically not required, but she gives iClicker questions during class, which count as a grade.

awesome professor for bio lab. i couldn't have gotten a better professor honestly. she is very honest, helpful, and caring. she doesn't grade too heavy at all, and she helps with understanding content. there's no way to fail or get under a B unless you just don't show up. she truly is one of the best!

She was nice, but the material covered in class and on the iClicker questions was often waaay easier than the SuperQuiz (test) questions. You really need to read the textbook to get the detail you need for tests. You have to learn next week's topic for the quizzes on Fridays.

Overall good professor. Hw and a module every week with a super-quiz every two weeks. She offers a fair amount of extra credit. She is also very available outside of class. She is a nice professor that just wants her students to pass.

Great professor. She manages to make a fairly difficult, information-heavy course interesting and enjoyable, even for students who don't have a strong interest in biology. I would highly recommend her.
I had to self teach myself throughout this course on some of the material, vocabs quizzes were very easy so was her homework assigments, you just have to attend her lectures to pass this course.

Awesome Professor. If you work hard like you should in college its a breeze but if you treat it like high school you will struggle. Theres far more tougher classes with worse professors but Professor Anglin was straightforward and all the tests questions were from lecure notes. I took for summer and as a junior I found it quite enjoyable.

I would take this class again! We have a vocab quiz and homework every week which are pretty easy. She takes time to explain concepts and is super caring when answering questions. If you just attend class and take notes you'll get an A. I really believe any bad reviews are people who don't feel like putting in effort.

Great professor! She is always very understanding, and willing to help students. One HW and vocab quiz per week. She makes her own PowerPoint that contains all the important information from the textbook, which really reduces the reading needed. However, attending classes and making notes are required to success.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Very easy going and understanding. She does use lockdown browser only because that is policy I guess, but quizzes aren't very hard.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Have to learn two units worth of material (vocab of next unit/current material) every unit. Information comes from different places in massive amounts and you won't know of which will be on the test. Little inconsistencies and her own insecurity/ignorance erode trust of this professor. Such an anxiety-inducing course set-up and teaching strategy.

This professor seemed ok at first but everything is on lockdown browser which is just annoying. You have to come to class to do some of the assignments which is also annoying. The actual problem though is that she is super strict with grading and acts as though she just learned the material she's teaching. Not a fan of this class
She wasn't bad but definitely wasn't the best. You will be teaching yourself basically. By any means choose another professor!!!!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Anglin was an incredibly fair and genuine person, she deeply cares about her students and really wants each student to succeed. I took her class for a summer semester so there was a bit more work due each week, but it was very manageable and never felt overwhelming. she also regularly offers extra credit, take her class.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Love this teacher! She was passionate about what she was teaching and encouraged questions. She allowed you to learn and mess up along the way without making you feel stupid. She gave me lots of time on stuff and had lots of grace with her students. She wrote me a wonderful letter of recommendation after class as well. Show up and have fun!

She is very lenient when it comes to grading the lab worksheets. The only thing she grades hard are the posters, as long as you follow the rubric you will do great! She had a review day specifically for the exam a week in advance and it helped! Everything she breaks down and explains in the lab will be on the exam and she tells you that!
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Took her for bio1107 lab and she made this course easy. How she explained the lab and how to use certain instruments was clear and she would always help If you didn't understand the first time. She was also very hands-on so she'll show you how to basically do the entire lab as well. Very easy to access outside of class, overall very nice professor

So I liked the professor. While explaining how the body uses glucose, she heavily discussed why we should not eat/drink sugars daily.Also i sometimes felt like I was teaching her, especially when talking about intersex people. She is a fair grader and no homework just submitting notes. You do have to be in class in order to get notes and do the LC

There are quizzes due every week, very strict on attendance and being on time. Does give extra credit but BEWARE she is a Very tough grader especially on her posters since they weigh the most. Instruction wise she is  just ok... isn't a very detailed professor and lacks in helping you prepare for the final exam. She is not the person to take imo.

Ms. Anglin is a great first year teacher, super helpful and answers questions well. Her coursework is incredibly heavy, tests every week and a ton of studying/homework. It does help with grades though if you can keep up with it. Expect a LOT of effort and to work for your grade. She gives a lot of extra credit though, and supports her students.

You will be teaching yourself the whole semester. She teaches how she understands not how her students do. There are no exams but 8 super quizzes and no material matches what her quizzes ask. Your best bet is to read and take notes from the chapter not from her lectures bc you will not understand. Lockdown browser and webcam very strict about it.
Ms. Anglin was so nice and very good at explaining what we needed to learn. She was very on top of things and provided extra credit assignments throughout the year. Take her!

She was a very tough grader if you didn't follow the rubric for the posters you will fail she's great when it comes to extra credit but out of all my classes she demanded the most work and this is coming from a CS major she gives out labs every week and you must attend or you will fail. Trim wisely with her
She is a very sweet and caring professor. Loves to laugh, but also has a huge passion for what she does, very knowledgeable. Be weary of big assignments though, she grades harsh on those.

Such a great lab professor. She gave clear guidelines for all assignments and gave great feedback on all submitted assignments. She also gave lots of extra credit. She is also very accessible through email and office hours and will answer all of your questions. Definitely would recommend her!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Great professor, she constantly took out things that were repetitive and unnecessary and that's saying a lot from bio lab since everything is the exact same in every class. She can grade tough on reports and such but overall she gives you a chance to make it up with extra credit. Just do everything by the rubric and you will make a decent grade.

Professor Anglin was one of my favorite professors last semester. She is extremely nice and understanding when you make a mistake or if you need help on a lab. Lab worksheets were very easy and tests consisted of pre lab questions related to each week. Helpful when it comes to posters and is actually funny. She is a grad student so she understands.

She is really sweet. There are weekly quizzes and lab worksheets, but she reviews the answers in class. She is understanding if you miss lab with an excuse. She gives great feedback for posters and assist during the final exam. Best bio 1107 lab teacher I say.

Very good lab teacher. Super nice person as well. She is helpful and gives good feedback on assignments and projects. Gives lots of extra credit opportunities. Class grades consist of weekly quizzes online, weekly lab assignments, 2 poster submissions, a presentation over one of the posters, and a final.

Ms. Anglin was a wonderful professor and made biology super easy. She was accessible and devoted a lot of time to her students. There were a lot of extra credit opportunities throughout the semester, and she graded fairly on all of her assignments. This was an easy A, and I definitely recommend her class.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: She is really nice. She gives lots of extra credit. She doesn't explain stuff well though.
